title: Senior Recruiter
location: {'id': 4001884005, 'name': 'New York, New York, United States', 'office_id': 4000844005, 'job_post_custom_location_id': None, 'job_post_location_type': {'id': 4000001005, 'name': 'Offices only'}}
content:
As we enter into this next phase of growth, we are looking to more than double our team and implement creative talent processes and strategies that can preserve and grow our culture of innovation. We are looking to make our first talent acquisition hire to help us scale and build out a world-class team. While the majority of our hiring will be for technical roles, we are looking for a technical recruiter to help us build a leading and diverse engineering team.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop overall talent acquisition strategy
  • Build out processes and tools necessary to manage TA at scale
  • End-to-end recruitment from sourcing through to close
  • Understand business goal and manage internal stakeholders to drive outcomes
  • Partner with hiring managers to develop and execute systematic hiring process across all searches
  • Develop and maintain an excellent candidate experience
  • Identify, source, and interview candidates
  • Manage recruiting support team

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of talent acquisition at a high growth company
  • Experience recruiting for technical and non technical positions
  • Ability to think strategically about how to achieve goals and the humility and execution orientation necessary to achieve them
  • Equally comfortable sourcing candidates as you interviewing and building relationships with them
  • Team management experience desired but not required
  • Passion for crypto and decentralized finance

Nice to Haves:

  • Love for unicorns <3

title: Recruiting Coordinator
location: {'id': 4002541005, 'name': 'New York, New York, United States', 'office_id': 4000844005, 'job_post_custom_location_id': None, 'job_post_location_type': {'id': 4000001005, 'name': 'Offices only'}}
content:
We are looking for an energetic, people person to assist us with finding, attracting and hiring talent across Uniswap Labs. You'll be responsible for keeping the recruiting trains running on time - making sure no candidate gets less than the attention they deserve. This will be the second Recruiting Coordinator of our growing team and will be a hybrid position out of our SoHo office.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with recruiters and hiring managers to manage various hiring pipelines
  • Schedule interviews and debriefs
  • Help create a stellar candidate experience, inclusive of maintaining an office space that candidates and employees love going to
  • Stay closely in touch with candidates and their timelines throughout the process
  • Assist in planning, coordinating and setting up networking and recruiting events
  • Onboard new hires so that they are up and running as soon as possible

Requirements:

  • Proficiency with an Applicant Tracking System or willingness to quickly learn
  • Comfortable working with Google Calendar and managing events on multiple calendars
  • Energetic and strong interpersonal skills to represent us externally
  • Self-motivated to get things done without waiting for directions

Nice to Haves:

  • Experience with Greenhouse
  • 1+ years of experience recruiting at a fast growing company
  • Excited and curious about blockchain, crypto and/or DeFi
  • Love for unicorns :)

location: {'id': 4002656005, 'name': 'New York, New York, United States', 'office_id': 4000844005, 'job_post_custom_location_id': None, 'job_post_location_type': {'id': 4000001005, 'name': 'Offices only'}}
content:
Uniswap Labs is hiring for Enterprise Partnerships.
 
We are looking to hire a seasoned sell-side research sales professional with established hedge fund and/or asset manager relationships to head up our Traditional Finance (TradFi) partnerships. This role is as much about business development strategy as it is business development execution. You will need to be able to and have the relationships and deep financial understanding necessary to drive sales, user research and product discovery/strategy (e.g. do we need permission pools? what L&C considerations do we need to address?).

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and establish partnerships with traditional finance capital that will trade or provide liquidity on Uniswap
  • Ability to identify relevant partnerships/integrations, take initiative, and own the sales cycle end-to-end
  • Help shape our product strategy 
  • Develop tools that will support TradFi activity

Requirements:

  • 5-15 years of experience in sell-side research sales
  • Established relationships with hedge funds and/or asset managers to drive sales
  • Deep understanding of finance including how decision making works at fund, including legal & compliance considerations
  • Passion for crypto and how to grow crypto adoption in traditional finance
  • Strategic thinker & resourceful problem solver
  • Tenacious with strong interpersonal and communication skills

Nice to Haves:

  • Love for unicorns :)

title: Community Lead
location: {'id': 4002657005, 'name': 'New York or US-based Remote ', 'office_id': 4000845005, 'job_post_custom_location_id': None, 'job_post_location_type': {'id': 4000001005, 'name': 'Offices only'}}
content:
The Uniswap community is one of the most impactful groups, inclusive of everyone from developers to traders. We’re looking for a Community Lead with a strong understanding of Ethereum, DeFi fundamentals, decentralized communities and community-building tools to support and engage with the Uniswap community.
 
This role will be a highly visible role in the organization and in the broader ecosystem. You will not only manage our day-to-day online presence, you will also be responsible for keeping your finger on the pulse of what’s happening in the DeFi and greater crypto space. You will help with hiring and training a team of global community managers. You should love community-building and have a knack for developing online relationships. You will be joining a lean team, and this role will have a lot of autonomy-- you should be a self-starter and be capable of self-directed work. This role will be impactful to our ever-growing community - reinventing what a community is at the heart of crypto.
 
Most importantly, you should care deeply about the mission of decentralized communities and decentralized finance and always be thinking of creative ways to help spread the word.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand Uniswap’s tone and messaging and apply this by engaging with users on twitter and in our discord
  • Deep technical understanding of Uniswap’s mechanisms and ability to answer questions and speak to users and integration partners
  • Manage support requests
  • Attend virtual and in person conferences and hackathons, support hackers, and generally engage with the developer community around Uniswap
  • Create fun community engagement programs, such as giveaways or virtual events
  • Host a monthly Uniswap community call
  • Manage our mailing list and create periodic newsletter updates
  • Create dank memes
  • Develop new ways of engaging with our users and community
  • Work with the business development team to turn community engagement into active BD opportunities
  • Thought leadership on issues in the DeFi space via twitter and the Uniswap blog

Requirements:

  • Experience working in community management for a crypto project
  • Organizational skills
  • Self-directed worker
  • Ability to respond very quickly across all of our platforms
  • Sense of humor

Nice to Haves:

  • Degree in computer science/self-taught engineer
  • Active following on twitter
  • Existing relationships in the crypto space
  • Fondness for the color pink
  • Love for unicorns :)

Minimum full-time salary of $110,000-$150,000. Disclosure in accordance with New York City's Pay Transparency Law. Full Time employees at Uniswap Labs are also eligible for other compensation elements, including equity, tokens, and benefits, dependent on the position type.

title: Technical Writer
location: {'id': 4002748005, 'name': 'New York, New York, United States', 'office_id': 4000844005, 'job_post_custom_location_id': None, 'job_post_location_type': {'id': 4000001005, 'name': 'Offices only'}}
content:
As a technical writer, you'll be working closely with the product development team to explain how Uniswap Protocol works at every level. There's some catchup we want to play in terms of our docs, as well as supporting new functionality on our existing roadmap.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the team to create and maintain a central docs site for the Uniswap Protocol - targeted at fast growing audience of external developers, traders and crypto curious visitors
  • Identify and write User Guides and Tutorials targeting popular user actions/flows on the site (like trading, adding liquidity, etc)
  • Monitor external channels (like Discord) where target audience of these docs may provide feedback

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience working closely with engineers to document, understand and explain technical concepts
  • Excellent English writing skills (and please submit a link to a sample as part of your application)
  • Comfortable reading code (with some pointers when necessary) to parse out salient steps
  • Creative skills and usage of pictures, drawings, diagrams, animation, and charts that may increase understanding
  • Keen eye for honing in on the most important bits to explain a complex topic, without skipping the details

Nice to Haves:

  • Prior experience in crypto/finance industry
  • Prior experience as a writer, technical writer, community manager, developer evangelist/relations, etc.
  • Comfortable submitting changes via Github (website UI or otherwise)
  • Love for Unicorns :)

content:

We’re looking for an enthusiastic and creative full-stack engineer to build the next generation of our developer documentation product. You are the perfect candidate if you have extensive experience developing in modern SSG frameworks (Next.js preferred), with the ability to autonomously structure a project from the ground up with modern best practices and appropriate abstractions.

  • Build and improve the tools and systems that enable Uniswap Labs to produce and maintain high-quality documentation

  • Assess current authoring systems and make it easier to create, maintain, and deploy accurate documentation for our developer interfaces (protocol, smart contracts, SDKs, and APIs)
  • Raise the bar for product quality while ensuring the documentation continues to grow in scope with the evolutions of the Uniswap Protocol

Requirements

  • Have a passion for building engaging and intuitive user experiences, and a keen eye for detail
  • Enjoy working across the stack, from frontend to backend, to solve complex challenges and delight our users
  • Experience with React, Next.js, and other frontend technologies
  • Understanding of SSG best practices, SEO
  • Ability to streamline and automate contribution pipelines, CI, testing, and release cycles

Nice to Have

  • Prior experience developing markdown-driven static sites.
  • Love for unicorns :)

  • Love for unicorns :)

internal_content:
The Uniswap community is one of the most impactful groups, inclusive of everyone from developers to traders. We’re looking for a Community Lead with a strong understanding of Ethereum, DeFi fundamentals, decentralized communities and community-building tools to support and engage with the Uniswap community.
 
This role will be a highly visible role in the organization and in the broader ecosystem. You will not only manage our day-to-day online presence, you will also be responsible for keeping your finger on the pulse of what’s happening in the DeFi and greater crypto space. You will help with hiring and training a team of global community managers. You should love community-building and have a knack for developing online relationships. You will be joining a lean team, and this role will have a lot of autonomy-- you should be a self-starter and be capable of self-directed work. This role will be impactful to our ever-growing community - reinventing what a community is at the heart of crypto.
 
Most importantly, you should care deeply about the mission of decentralized communities and decentralized finance and always be thinking of creative ways to help spread the word.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand Uniswap’s tone and messaging and apply this by engaging with users on twitter and in our discord
  • Deep technical understanding of Uniswap’s mechanisms and ability to answer questions and speak to users and integration partners
  • Manage support requests
  • Attend virtual and in person conferences and hackathons, support hackers, and generally engage with the developer community around Uniswap
  • Create fun community engagement programs, such as giveaways or virtual events
  • Host a monthly Uniswap community call
  • Manage our mailing list and create periodic newsletter updates
  • Create dank memes
  • Develop new ways of engaging with our users and community
  • Work with the business development team to turn community engagement into active BD opportunities
  • Thought leadership on issues in the DeFi space via twitter and the Uniswap blog

Requirements:

  • Experience working in community management for a crypto project
  • Organizational skills
  • Self-directed worker
  • Ability to respond very quickly across all of our platforms
  • Sense of humor

Nice to Haves:

  • Degree in computer science/self-taught engineer
  • Active following on twitter
  • Existing relationships in the crypto space
  • Fondness for the color pink
  • Love for unicorns :)

Labs. Your role with stretch across fiat and crypto and will partner with the best
accounting, technical, and legal minds in the space to translate new technology and
financials models into compliant financial statements and tax filings. You will play a
key role in supporting our rapidly growing organization and provide a world-class
experience to our talented team.

Responsibilities:

  • Create proper financials and operational controls over accounts, crypto
    wallets, and critical processes
  • Manage external accountants and tax professionals to produce financials
    statements and tax documents
  • Monitor on-chain transactions; reconcile token treasury balances with the
    assistance of external service providers
  • Oversee all tax filings – corporate tax returns, franchise, state, and city taxes,
    1099-MISC, etc.
  • Oversee payroll and A/P processes
  • Lead the Company’s financial audit in accordance with US GAAP
  • Collaborate cross-departmentally on ad-hoc finance, tax, or operations
    related projects
  • Possible to add FP&A for candidates with the appropriate skill-set

Requirements:

  • Accounting degree with 8+ years of experience in an accounting or finance
    role
  • Ability to problem-solve and make decisions independently
  • Strong communicator with the ability to work effectively and confidently with
    senior stakeholders, and operate at all levels within the company
  • Comfort with executing crypto transactions through third-party custody
    website (e.g. Coinbase), or an eagerness to learn
  • Ability to pivot quickly and adapt to competing and ever-changing priorities
  • Optimistic, can-do attitude with superior attention to detail

Nice to Haves:

  • CPA
  • FP&A experience in addition to controller experience and skills

  • Create a unified component library for use across all Uniswap products

  • Understand when and how to run UI tests


Requirements
  • At least 3 years of React experience
  • A deep understanding of the architecture of modern client-side React applications
  • Prior experience working with component libraries or design teams in user-facing applications
  • A desire to keep up with modern best practices in web development


Nice to have
  • Prior experience creating a design system or component library
  • Familiarity with the web3 frontend stack (ethers.js/web3.js, EIP-1193, client-side private key management, etc.)
  • Familiarity with React Hooks
  • Experience with TypeScript in React
  • Degree in computer science
  • Love for unicorns :)


Tech stack
  • Our interface is totally open source
  • Base: React + TypeScript + Jest (via create-react-app v4)
  • Web3: ethers + web3-react 
  • State management: redux(app), jotai(widget), redux-multicall (contracts)

title: Community Manager
location: {'id': 4010254005, 'name': 'New York or US-based Remote ', 'office_id': 4000845005, 'job_post_custom_location_id': None, 'job_post_location_type': {'id': 4000001005, 'name': 'Offices only'}}
content:
We need someone to help manage our community presence. We have highly engaged community, and we are looking for someone who has a strong understanding of Ethereum and DeFi fundamentals to support and engage with this community. This role will be a highly visible role in the organization and in the broader ecosystem. The ideal candidate for this role would be someone with a huge passion and intellectual curiosity for all things DeFi. You will not only manage our day-to-day online presence, you will also be responsible for keeping your finger on the pulse of what’s happening in the DeFi and greater crypto space. You will also help with hiring and training a team of global community managers. You should love community building and have a knack for developing online relationships. You will be joining a small and scrappy team, and this role will have a lot of autonomy-- you should be a self-starter and be capable of self-directed work. You should be well spoken and insightful, but also funny--someone that our users want to engage with on the day to day. Most importantly, you should care deeply about the mission of decentralized finance and always be thinking of creative ways to help spread the word. 



Responsibilities
  • Understand Uniswap’s tone and messaging and apply this by engaging with users on twitter and in our discord 
  • Deep technical understanding of Uniswap’s mechanisms and ability to answer questions and speak to users and integration partners 
  • Manage support requests 
  • Attend virtual and in person conferences and hackathons, support hackers, and generally engage with the developer community around Uniswap 
  • Create fun community engagement programs, such as giveaways or virtual events 
  • Host a monthly Uniswap community call 
  • Manage our mailing list and create periodic newsletter updates 
  • Create dank memes 
  • Develop new wants of engaging with our users and community 
  • Work with the business development team to turn community engagement into active BD opportunities 
  • Thought leadership on issues in the DeFi space via twitter and the Uniswap blog 


Requirements
  • Experience working in community management for a crypto project 
  • Organizational skills 
  • Self-directed worker 
  • Ability to respond very quickly across all of our platforms
  • Sense of humor  


Nice to have
  • Degree in computer science/self-taught engineer 
  • Active following on twitter
  • Existing relationships in the crypto space 
  • Fondness for the color pink
  • Love for unicorns :)

content:
We have the best investors in the world--Andreessen Horowitz, Paradigm, Union Square Ventures, and others.

We’re looking for an enthusiastic and brilliant lawyer to help us manage all of the operational aspects of the company. You will have ownership over corporate, transactional, and employment law, potentially assist on finance, and have the ability to learn from and take on regulatory, compliance, and public policy work streams. We are building the next generation of financial infrastructure. As an early hire, you will have an incredible opportunity for career growth.

You will be responsible for ensuring consistent, high-quality legal operations supporting the company as it grows. This is a full time role which includes health insurance and other benefits. Compensation is highly competitive and will be commensurate with experience.


Responsibilities
  • Corporate law—fundraising, equity management, board resolutions
  • Transactional law—reviewing and drafting contracts
  • Employment law—owning offer letters and all other employee agreements, policies, and issues
  • Intellectual property—supporting the engineering team regarding IP ownership and building software in an open-source environment
  • Cross-functional thought partner—being involved with the CLO on all legal, regulatory, and policy matters and owning more as the company grows 


Requirements
  • All levels will be considered. Title and responsibilities will adjust to your experience. Minimum one year of experience at a top law firm specializing in the technology or financial industry .
  • J.D. from a top 20 law school.
  • A willingness to take on considerable responsibility and intellectual challenges.


Nice to have (though definitely not required)
  • A previous role in-house at a tech, finance, or cryptocurrency company
  • Any experience in finance, accounting, or computer science (even classes in school)

location: {'id': 4010274005, 'name': 'New York or US-based Remote ', 'office_id': 4000845005, 'job_post_custom_location_id': None, 'job_post_location_type': {'id': 4000001005, 'name': 'Offices only'}}
content:
Uniswap is hiring a community lead. We have highly engaged community, and we are looking for someone who has a strong understanding of Ethereum and DeFi fundamentals to support and engage with this community. This role will be a highly visible role in the organization and in the broader ecosystem. The ideal candidate for this role would be someone with a huge passion and intellectual curiosity for all things DeFi. You will not only manage our day-to-day online presence, you will also be responsible for keeping your finger on the pulse of what’s happening in the DeFi and greater crypto space. You will also help with hiring and training a team of global community managers. You are encouraged to think big about educational tools, events and anything else you think can help engage more people and get them interested in helping forward our mission.

You should love community building and have a knack for developing online relationships. You will be joining a small and scrappy team, and this role will have a lot of autonomy-- you should be a self-starter and be capable of self-directed work. You should be well spoken and insightful, but also funny--someone that our users want to engage with on the day to day. Most importantly, you should care deeply about the mission of decentralized finance and always be thinking of creative ways to help spread the word. 


Responsiblities
  • Understand Uniswap’s tone and messaging and apply this by engaging with users on twitter and in our discord 
  • Deep technical understanding of Uniswap’s mechanisms and ability to answer questions and speak to users and integration partners 
  • Manage support requests 
  • Attend virtual and in person conferences and hackathons, support hackers, and generally engage with the developer community around Uniswap 
  • Create fun community engagement programs, such as giveaways or virtual events 
  • Host a monthly Uniswap community call 
  • Manage our mailing list and create periodic newsletter updates 
  • Create dank memes 
  • Develop new wants of engaging with our users and community 
  • Work with the business development team to turn community engagement into active BD opportunities 
  • Thought leadership on issues in the DeFi space via twitter and the Uniswap blog 


Requirements
  • Experience working in community management for a crypto project 
  • Organizational skills 
  • Self-directed worker 
  • Ability to respond very quickly across all of our platforms
  • Sense of humor

Uniswap Labs is hiring for DeFi Partnerships.

We are looking to expand our Growth division, bringing on a new team member to help us accelerate our partnerships and integrations over the coming years as DeFi transitions from a small community of users to a credible alternative to the legacy financial system. 

Integrations and partnerships have played a vital role in the Uniswap Protocol’s success to date: today, the protocol counts over 200 integrations across partner protocols, wallets, data analytics providers, among other categories. 

Our goal is to build simple, powerful, and beautiful tools that democratize access to financial services. This role is not a revenue generation role: rather, it is about helping the DeFi industry leverage the Uniswap Protocol as robust and neutral exchange and liquidity provision infrastructure. 

Candidates must have strong backgrounds in DeFi, whether as an operator, researcher, business development representative, or investor. You should have been consistently performing at the top of your peer group in your prior roles. You must have thorough experience with the DeFi ecosystem as well as a deep understanding of how the Uniswap Protocol works. 


Need to haves:
  • Background and established network in DeFi
  • Deep understanding of the Uniswap Protocol and potential areas for integration 
  • Excellent organizational skills 
  • Ability to identify relevant partnerships/integrations, take initiative, and own the sales cycle end-to-end
  • Friendly, charismatic, and able to close deals 


Nice to haves:
  • Technical background 
  • Experience in business development/sales
  • Strong understanding of Ethereum and the emerging DeFi ecosystem

Responsibilities
  • Work closely with the team to create and maintain a central docs site for the Uniswap Protocol - targeted at fast growing audience of external developers, traders and crypto curious visitors
  • Identify and write User Guides and Tutorials targeting popular user actions/flows on the site (like trading, adding liquidity, etc)
  • Monitor external channels (like Discord) where target audience of these docs may provide feedback

  • 2+ years of experience working closely with engineers to document, understand and explain technical concepts
  • Excellent English writing skills (and please submit a link to a sample as part of your application)
  • Comfortable reading code (with some pointers when necessary) to parse out salient steps
  • Creative skills and usage of pictures, drawings, diagrams, animation, and charts that may increase understanding
  • Keen eye for honing in on the most important bits to explain a complex topic, without skipping the details


Nice to have
  • Prior experience in crypto/finance industry
  • Prior experience as a writer, technical writer, community manager, developer evangelist/relations, etc.
  • Comfortable submitting changes via Github (website UI or otherwise)

  • Strategic and analytical thinker who can both see the picture but develop and execute plans to drive bottom-line success
